review: This is an amazing little device. It does not have any where near the range of channels that a Roku device offers, but it works very well with Netflix, which is our primary channel for movies. With Chromecast, there is no disruption of either the video or audio in a movie. It's so easy to use that it could be taken on trips to use in motels and hotels.

review: My Chromecast worked for an hour after setup, then mysteriously disappeared from both my phone and laptop. It was clearly still on the network because the music continued to play, but I could no longer control it. It would reappear after going through the reset process, then again disappear. After much fruitless searching, I wrote Chromecast and learned they only support HDCP devices. I discovered this is a copy protection protocol, but NOWHERE do they mention this requirement. Apparently my TV and Bose home entertainment system predate this development, so I am returning my Christmas gift after needless hours of frustration.

review: After purchasing my first one the same day it was released I was a little disappointed in the number of supported apps. After a few months owning one, I ordered another one for my bedroom.  I find that the most important content that I watch is supported (Youtube, Netflix, Hulu) and new apps/content is being added regularly.  This platform has a ton of potential.I really enjoy the interface of this device.  Since I am normally using my phone or tablet while watching TV, this makes a perfect extension of that experience.  This is one of the few ways to broadcast Youtube content on my TV and it does it well.The one improvement I would like to see if the ability to stream content stored on your device to your TV (your videos and pictures you captured on your phone/tablet's camera).
